==Events==
*[[1218]] &ndash; The [[Fifth Crusade]] leaves [[Acre, Israel|Acre]] for [[Egypt]].
*[[1276]] &ndash; [[Magnus III of Sweden|Magnus Ladulås]] is crowned [[King of Sweden]] in [[Uppsala Cathedral]].
*[[1487]] &ndash; The ten-year-old [[Lambert Simnel]] is crowned in [[Christ Church Cathedral, Dublin|Christ Church Cathedral]] in [[Dublin]], Ireland, with the name of Edward VI in a bid to threaten [[Henry VII of England|King Henry VII]]'s reign.
*[[1595]] &ndash; ''[[Nomenclator (nomenclature)|Nomenclator]]'' of [[Leiden University Library]] appears, the first printed catalog of an institutional library.
*[[1607]] &ndash; 100 English settlers disembark in [[Jamestown, Virginia|Jamestown]], the first English colony in America.
*[[1621]] &ndash; The [[Protestant Union]] is formally dissolved.
*[[1626]] &ndash; [[Peter Minuit]] buys [[Manhattan]].
*[[1667]]  &ndash; The [[French Royal Army (1652–1830)|French Royal Army]] crosses the border into the [[Spanish Netherlands]], starting the [[War of Devolution]] opposing [[Kingdom of France|France]] to the [[Spanish Empire]] and the [[Triple Alliance (1668)|Triple Alliance]].
*[[1689]] &ndash; The [[Parliament of England|English Parliament]] passes the [[Act of Toleration 1689|Act of Toleration]] protecting [[Protestantism|Protestants]]. [[Roman Catholics]] are intentionally excluded.
*[[1738]] &ndash; [[John Wesley]] is [[New Birth|converted]], essentially launching the [[Methodism|Methodist movement]]; the day is celebrated annually by [[Methodists]] as [[Aldersgate Day]] and a church service is generally held on the preceding Sunday.
*[[1798]] &ndash; The [[Irish Rebellion of 1798]] led by the [[Society of the United Irishmen|United Irishmen]] against [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] rule begins.
*[[1813]] &ndash; South American [[independence]] leader [[Simón Bolívar]] enters [[Mérida, Mérida|Mérida]], leading the invasion of [[Venezuela]], and is proclaimed ''El Libertador'' ("The Liberator").
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Battle of Pichincha]]: [[Antonio José de Sucre]] secures the independence of the [[Presidency]] of [[Quito]].
*[[1830]] &ndash; ''[[Mary Had a Little Lamb]]'' by [[Sarah Josepha Hale]] is published.
*  1830   &ndash; The first revenue trains in the United States begin service on the [[Baltimore and Ohio Railroad]] between [[Baltimore, Maryland]], and [[Ellicott's Mills, Maryland]].
*[[1832]] &ndash; The [[First Kingdom of Greece]] is declared in the [[London Conference of 1832|London Conference]].
*[[1844]] &ndash; [[Samuel Morse]] sends the message "What hath God wrought" (a [[Bible|biblical]] quotation, [[Book of Numbers|Numbers]] 23:23) from the [[Old Supreme Court Chamber]] in the [[United States Capitol]] to his assistant, [[Alfred Vail]], in [[Baltimore]], [[Maryland]], to inaugurate the first [[Telegraphy|telegraph]] line.
*[[1856]] &ndash; [[John Brown (abolitionist)|John Brown]] and his men [[Pottawatomie Massacre|kill five slavery supporters]] at [[Pottawatomie Creek]], [[Kansas]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops occupy [[Alexandria, Virginia]].
*[[1883]] &ndash; The [[Brooklyn Bridge]] in [[New York City]] is opened to traffic after 14 years of construction.
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[Henry Irving]] becomes the first person from the [[theatre]] to be [[knight]]ed.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: The United Kingdom annexes the [[Orange Free State]].
*[[1901]] &ndash; Seventy-eight miners die in the [[Caerphilly]] pit disaster in [[South Wales]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Kingdom of Italy|Italy]] declares war on [[Austria-Hungary]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; The trial of [[Sacco and Vanzetti]] opens.
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[Amy Johnson]] lands in [[Darwin, Northern Territory]], becoming the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia (she left on [[May 5]] for the 11,000 mile flight).
*[[1935]] &ndash; The first [[night game]] in [[Major League Baseball]] history is played in [[Cincinnati, Ohio]], with the [[Cincinnati Reds]] beating the [[Philadelphia Phillies]] 2-1 at [[Crosley Field]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Igor Sikorsky]] performs the first successful single-rotor [[helicopter]] flight.
* 1940   &ndash; Acting on the orders of [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] leader [[Joseph Stalin]], [[NKVD]] agent [[Iosif Grigulevich]] orchestrates an unsuccessful assassination attempt on exiled Russian revolutionary [[Leon Trotsky]] in [[Coyoacán]], [[Mexico]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: In the [[Battle of the Atlantic (1939–1945)|Battle of the Atlantic]], the [[German battleship Bismarck|German Battleship ''Bismarck'']] sinks then-pride of the [[Royal Navy]], {{HMS|Hood|51|6}}, killing all but three crewmen.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust]]: [[Josef Mengele]] becomes chief medical officer of the [[Auschwitz]] [[Nazi concentration camps|concentration camp]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[1948 Arab–Israeli War|Arab–Israeli War]]: Egypt [[Battle of Yad Mordechai|captures]] the Israeli [[kibbutz]] of [[Yad Mordechai]], but the five-day effort gives Israeli forces time to prepare enough to stop the Egyptian advance a week later.
*[[1956]] &ndash; Conclusion of the [[Sixth Buddhist Council]] on [[Vesak]] Day, marking the 2,500 year anniversary after the Lord [[Gautama Buddha|Buddha]]'s [[Parinibbāna]].
*  1956   &ndash; The first [[Eurovision Song Contest]] is held in [[Lugano]], [[Switzerland]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[United Press International]] is formed through a merger of the [[United Press]] and the [[International News Service]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; Following the [[1960 Valdivia earthquake]], the largest ever recorded earthquake, [[Puyehue-Cordón Caulle#1960 eruption|Cordón Caulle begins to erupt]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[American civil rights movement]]: [[Freedom Riders]] are arrested in [[Jackson, Mississippi]], for "disturbing the peace" after disembarking from their bus.
*  1961   &ndash; [[Cyprus]] joins the [[Council of Europe]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Project Mercury]]: American [[astronaut]] [[Scott Carpenter]] orbits the [[Earth]] three times in the ''[[Aurora 7]]'' [[space capsule]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Baldwin–Kennedy meeting]] on race relations in the US
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Egypt]] imposes a blockade and siege of the [[Red Sea]] coast of [[Israel]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[FLQ]] separatists bomb the U.S. [[consulate]] in [[Quebec City]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[scientific drilling|drilling]] of the [[Kola Superdeep Borehole]] begins in the Soviet Union.
*[[1976]] &ndash; The London to [[Washington, D.C.]], [[Concorde]] service begins.
*1976 &ndash; The [[Judgement of Paris (wine)|Judgement of Paris]] takes place in France, launching [[California]] as a worldwide force in the production of quality [[wine]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; Ecuadorian president [[Jaime Roldós Aguilera]], his wife, and his presidential committee die in an aircraft accident while travelling from Quito to Zapotillo minutes after the president gave a famous speech regarding the 24 de mayo anniversary of the [[Battle of Pichincha]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Liberation of Khorramshahr]]: [[Demography of Iran|Iranians]] recapture of the port city of [[Khorramshahr]] from the [[Iraqis]] during the [[Iran–Iraq War]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Section 28]] of the United Kingdom's [[Local Government Act 1988]], a controversial amendment stating that a [[Local government in England|local authority]] cannot intentionally promote [[homosexuality]], is enacted.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Israel]] conducts [[Operation Solomon]], evacuating [[Ethiopia]]n [[Jew]]s to Israel.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The last [[Thailand|Thai]] [[dictator]], [[General]] [[Suchinda Kraprayoon]], resigns following pro-democracy protests.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Eritrea]] gains its independence from [[Ethiopia]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; Four men convicted of [[1993 World Trade Center bombing|bombing the World Trade Center in New York]] in 1993 are each sentenced to 240 years in prison.
*[[1999]] &ndash; The [[International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia]] in [[The Hague]], Netherlands indicts [[Slobodan Milošević]] and four others for [[war crime]]s and [[crimes against humanity]] committed in [[Kosovo]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; Israeli troops withdraw from [[southern Lebanon]] after 22 years of occupation.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Mountain climbing]]: [[Temba Tsheri]], a 16-year-old [[Sherpa people|Sherpa]], becomes the youngest person to climb to the top of [[Mount Everest]].
*  2001   &ndash; The [[Versailles wedding hall disaster]] in [[Jerusalem]], Israel kills 23 and injures over 200.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Russia]] and the [[United States]] sign the [[SORT|Moscow Treaty]].
